author: Michael Cronin
title: Service Comes First for this Merrimack Undergrad
text:
Just like Saint Augustine, the patron saint of Merrimack College, service has always been a primary focus for Jacob Symmes ‚Äô25.
As a youth, Symmes embarked on many service and mission trips, mostly working with the unhoused and providing hurricane relief. When it was time to enroll in college, he found Merrimack to be the perfect fit.
‚ÄúDuring my first tour here, I had an amazing impression of (the campus)‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt had a great program for me within the education field.‚Äù
Symmes is majoring in human development and services and plans on enrolling in the school counseling master‚Äôs program. Through the undergraduate program, he landed an internship with the New England Center for Children working with young adults with high-needs social or intellectual disabilities.
‚ÄúI feel that (school counseling is) where my skills are best, working with younger audiences,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúI have a passion for helping them become who they want to be and I want them to move to a place where they‚Äôre comfortable and feel safe.‚Äù
During his time at Merrimack, Symmes has found a community within Grace J. Palmisano Center for Campus Ministry .
‚ÄúThey just really draw you in here,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThey do a good job making those human connections and they‚Äôre just awesome people to be around. And I do like to connect with a spiritual part of myself in whatever way I find that to be in the present moment.‚Äù
Campus Ministry‚Äôs SEND program , the student-led service trip program, was a natural fit for Symmes. He has previously led two trips ‚Äì one saw Merrimack students building beds and collecting firewood for underserved families in Pine Ridge, South Dakota, and the other, students delivered food to those experiencing homelessness in New York City.
‚ÄúEvery night, there is reflection that we have prepared,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúWe discuss what went on that day, how we can connect it to our lives and what we‚Äôre doing to fight for others. We invite everybody in to understand our biases and find where things might cause tension.‚Äù
Now, Symmes is getting ready to lead his third trip this spring in Chicago.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôll be working to understand the issues of injustice there and why people are where they are,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking forward to meeting my group. It‚Äôs always fun to add some new strangers to your circle.‚Äù

author: AFP
title: Chili : un m√©gaprojet d'hydrog√®ne vert menace l'observation du ciel dans le d√©sert d'Atacama
text:
[Back to top](#skip-link)
Le dernier quartier de lune se couche derri√®re la plateforme du Very Large Telescope (VLT), √† l'Observatoire europ√©en austral (ESO) de Paranal dans le d√©sert d'Atacama, √† environ 1.150 km au nord de Santiago du Chili, le 21 juin 2022
L'Observatoire europ√©en austral (ESO) a alert√© jeudi sur les risques de pollution lumineuse li√©s √† un m√©gaprojet de production d'hydrog√®ne et d'ammoniac vert dans le nord du Chili, une r√©gion particuli√®rement propice √† l'observation du ciel.
"Ce complexe menace le ciel pur de l'Observatoire de Paranal de l'ESO dans le d√©sert d'Atacama", avertit l'organisation intergouvernementale dans un communiqu√©.
Fin d√©cembre, AES Andes, une filiale de la compagnie d'√©lectricit√© am√©ricaine AES Corporation, avait annonc√© soumettre le projet √† une √©tude d'impact sur l'environnement.
Le complexe industriel verrait le jour √† Taltal, dans la r√©gion d'Antofagasta, √† une dizaine de kilom√®tres de Paranal, o√π se trouve le Very Large Telescope (VLT), l'un des t√©lescopes les plus puissants au monde, et √† proximit√© duquel, un autre encore plus puissant, le Extremely Large Telescope (ELT), est en cours de construction.
"Les √©missions de poussi√®re pendant la construction, l'augmentation des turbulences atmosph√©riques et surtout la pollution lumineuse auront un impact irr√©parable sur les capacit√©s d'observation astronomique", explique le directeur g√©n√©ral de l'ESO, Xavier Barcons, dans le communiqu√©.
L'Observatoire de Paranal, construit et exploit√© par l'ESO, a √©t√© inaugur√© en 1999 √† 2.600 m√®tres d'altitude, en plein d√©sert d'Atacama, un endroit id√©al pour l'observation astronomique en raison de son climat sec, de son altitude et de l'absence de nuages et pluie.
Le complexe fait partie du r√©seau d'observatoires astronomiques situ√©s au Chili, qui comprend √©galement le radiot√©lescope ALMA et le t√©lescope optique de La Silla, √©galement dans le nord du pays.
Pour Itziar de Gregorio, repr√©sentant de l'ESO au Chili, "il est essentiel d'envisager d'autres emplacements pour ce m√©gaprojet qui ne mettent pas en danger l'un des tr√©sors astronomiques les plus importants du monde".
Sollicit√©e, AES Andes n'a pas fait de commentaire dans l'imm√©diat. Fin d√©cembre, l'entreprise avait indiqu√© que son projet comprenait "la production d'hydrog√®ne et d'ammoniac vert, ainsi que le d√©veloppement du solaire, de l'√©olien et du stockage des batteries", conform√©ment √† l'objectif du Chili d'accro√Ætre l'origine renouvelable de son mix √©nerg√©tique.
En octobre 2024, une nouvelle norme lumineuse est entr√©e en vigueur au Chili afin notamment de pr√©server l'observation astronomique. La r√©glementation √©tablit des limites de luminosit√© ou des heures maximales de fonctionnement pour les √©crans publicitaires.

author: Sarah Tate
title: 'Unmissable' South Carolina Eatery Serves The 'Best Barbecue' In The State | WVOC
text:
Barbecue comes in many forms ‚Äî ribs smoked for hours and slathered in sweet and smoky sauce, slow-cooked brisket covered in a flavorful dry rub, juicy pulled pork or shredded chicken perfect for crafting a delicious sandwich topped with slaw. Fortunately, there are plenty of incredible barbecue restaurants found all around the country that offer everyone the chance to dine on classic dishes.
According to a list compiled by LoveFood , the "best barbecue restaurant" in all of South Carolina is Lewis Barbecue. This popular eatery serves Texas barbecue that is worth sampling alongside its Carolina-style counterpart. Lewis Barbecue has locations in Charleston and Greenville. Find out more by visiting the restaurant's website .
Here's what the site had to say about the best "unmissable" barbecue in the state:
"At this popular joint, Texas barbecue is taken seriously. Meat is prepared in a custom-made smoker built by the pitmaster, and many people say the brisket is the best they've ever had. You order at the counter; choose your meat (brisket, pulled pork, turkey breast, house-made sausages, or ribs) by weight, then add on sides like smoky pinto beans, green chili born pudding, and tangy coleslaw. Kick back in the huge outdoor area and enjoy." See the full list at lovefood.com to read up on more of the tastiest barbecue joints around the country. In the mood for something sweet? You can also check out our previous coverage of the South Carolina eatery that serves the "best pancakes" in the state .
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->customs and tradition

author: Shabbir Dar
title: Army's help sought as torrential rains batter Islamabad, Rawalpindi
text:
Twin cities record 129mm of rain; cloudburst in Chakwal results in 423mm downpour
RAWALPINDI: Heavy downpour continued to lash Islamabad and neighbouring Rawalpindi with the twin cities receiving 129 millimetres of rain.
As per a Water and Sanitation Agency (Wasa) spokesperson, the authority's managing director has reached out to the Pakistan Army's 111 Brigade as it has been decided to call in the army in case of an emergency.
With the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) forecasting more downpour, sirens have been sounded in areas surrounding Nullah Leh as the water level has risen by 16 feet.
Wasa has said that a rain emergency has been imposed and its teams and heavy machinery have been deployed in low-lying areas of Rawalpindi with personnel busy in drainage efforts to address accumulated water.
"Nullah Leh and drains across the city are being continuously monitored," said Wasa MD, adding that the water level at Katarian was 16 feet and 14 feet at Gowalmandi Bridge.
Meanwhile, Rescue 1122 has also been put on high alert, with its district administration officer advising people to safe places before urban flooding and to evacuate dilapidated buildings.
So far, Saidpur has received 53mm of rain, 77mm in Golra, 95mm in Bokra, 67mm in Shamsabad, 105mm in Kachehri, 90mm in Pirwadhai and Gowalmandi and 80mm in Katarian.
Apart from the twin cities, various areas across Punjab continue to be battered by heavy rains. A cloud burst was witnessed in Chakwal, causing as much as 423mm of rain.
Several low-lying areas have been inundated with water, entering the houses. The district administration has said that a rescue operation was underway to move citizens to safer places.
As per the additional deputy commissioner, the dire situation is a result of a cloudburst.
This is a developing story and is being updated with more details.

author: Field Level Media
title: Justin Thomas, Jordan Spieth commit to Phoenix Open | Fieldlevel | news-daily.com
text:
The 2025 WM Phoenix Open is shaping up to feature one of the tournament's strongest fields in years with Justin Thomas and Jordan Spieth committing to the event this week.
They join the likes of Hideki Matsuyama, who won the season-opening The Sentry, world No. 7 Wyndham Clark and Billy Horschel. Last week, all three committed to play in the event at TPC Scottsdale, to be held Feb. 6-9.
Thomas, 31, is playing at The American Express in La Quinta, Calif., this week as he attempts to snap a winless drought that dates back to the 2022 PGA Championship.

author: Staff Report
title: Golden Globes 2024: Best looks from the red carpet
text:
Branded as ‚ÄúHollywood‚Äôs Party of the Year,‚Äù the
2024 Golden Globes officially kicks off this year‚Äôs awards season Sunday night, honoring film and television across 27 categories.
The 81st Annual Golden Globes will begin broadcasting live from The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, Calif. on Sunday, Jan. 7 at 8 p.m. EST on CBS. The three-hour ceremony will also be available on demand for Paramount+ with SHOWTIME subscribers, or on demand for Paramount+ Essential subscribers the day after.
Before the awards, viewers can scope out who‚Äôs wearing what and catch some off-the-cuff candor on the Golden Globes red carpet.
The Globes official digital pre-show is hosted by Variety‚Äôs Marc Malkin and Angelique Jackson, along with
‚ÄúEntertainment Tonight‚Äù correspondent Rachel Smith. Coverage begins at 6:30 p.m. EST on Paramount+, Variety‚Äòs digital and social platforms, ETOnline.com and the Golden Globe Awards website.
‚ÄúCBS Mornings‚Äù host
Gayle King has also been tapped to handle red carpet duties on Sunday evening. The Emmy Award-winning broadcaster will air her coverage Monday on the flagship morning show.
Here are some of the best looks from the Golden Globes 2024 red carpet:
Contributing: Karu F. Daniels, New York Daily News
